questions.questionText: The average score of a cricketer for 13 matches is 42 runs. If his average score for the first 5 matches is 54, then what was his average score (in runs) for last 8 matches?
A and B are two numbers. 6 times square of B is 540 more than the square of A. if the respective ratio between A and B is 3:2. What is the value of B?
The sum of a number and the two numbers preceding it is equal to 30. Find the number:
Sanjay invested an amount of Rs 16,000 for two years on compound interest and received an amount of RS 17,640 on maturity. What is the rate of interest per annum?
A reservoir is provided by two pipes A and B. A can fill the reservoir 5 hours faster than B. If both together fill the reservoir in 6 hours, the reservoir will be filled by A alone in
How many kgs of flour worth Rs 25 per kg must be blended with 30 kgs of flour worth Rs 30 per kg so that by selling the blended variety at Rs 30 per kg there should be a gain of 10%?
In a stream running at 2 km/h, a motor boat goes 10 km upstream and back again to the starting point in 55 min. The speed of the motorboat in still water is
A man can row 4.5 km/h in still water and he finds that it takes him twice as long to row up as to row down the river. The speed of the stream is
P, Q and R have a certain amount of money with themselves. Q has 50% more than what P has, and R has 1/3rd of
If tan ฮ = 3/4 and ฮ is acute, then cosec ฮ is
A vertical stick 12 cm long casts a shadow 8 cm long on the ground. At the same time, a tower casts a shadow 40m long on the ground. The height of the tower is
The respective ratio of radii of two right circular cylinders (A & B) is 3 : 2. The respective ratio of volumes of cylinders A and B is 9 : 7, then what are the heights of cylinders A and B?
What is the area of an equilateral triangle of side 16cm ?
Consider the following figure. <A=x+30; <D= x-40. Find <B?
Find the area of a square, the product of whose diagonals is 66 cm2
A 5 cubic centimeter cube is painted on all its side. If it is sliced into 1 cubic centimeter cubes, how many 1 cubic centimeter cubes will have exactly one of their sides painted?
Find the area of a trapezium whose parallel sides are 20 cm and 18 cm long, and the distance between them is 15 cm.
Examine the figure. <ADB=25o; Find <OBC:
The sector of a circle has radius of 21 cm and central angle 1350. Find its perimeter.
The volumes of two cones are in the ratio of 1 :10 and the radii of the cones are in the ratio of 1 : 2, what is the ratio of their vertical heights?
The average of 5 quantities is 6. The average of 3 of them is 8. What is the average of the remaining two numbers?

The average temperature on Wednesday, Thursday and Friday was 250. The average temperature on Thursday, Friday and Saturday was 240. If the temperature on Saturday was 270, what was the temperature on Wednesday?
The average age of a group of 12 students is 20years. If 4 more students join the group, the average age increases by 1 year. The average age of the new students is :
When a student weighing 45 kgs left a class, the average weight of the remaining 59 students increased by 200g. What is the average weight of the remaining 59 students?
The average of 5 quantities is 10 and the average of 3 of them is 9. What is the average of the remaining 2?
The average age of a family of 5 members is 20 years. If the age of the youngest member be 10 years then what was the average age of the family at the time of the birth of the youngest member?
Average cost of 5 apples and 4 mangoes is Rs.36. The average cost of 7 apples and 8 mangoes is Rs.48. Find the total cost of 24 apples and 24 mangoes.
Tea worth Rs. 126 per kg and Rs. 135 per kg are mixed with a third variety in the ratio 1 : 1 : 2. If the mixture is worth Rs. 153 per kg, the price of the third variety per kg will be:
A trader makes a profit equal to the selling price of 75 articles when he sold 100 of the articles. What % profit did he make in the transaction?

A merchant buys two articles for Rs.600. He sells one of them at a profit of 22% and the other at a loss of 8% and makes no profit or loss in the end. What is the selling price of the article that he sold at a loss?
A trader professes to sell his goods at a loss of 8% but weights 900 grams in place of a kg weight. Find his real loss or gain per cent.
Rajiv sold an article for Rs.56 which cost him Rs.x. If he had gained x% on his outlay, what was his cost?
A trader buys goods at a 19% Amount on the label price. If he wants to make a profit of 20% after allowing a Amount of 10%, by what % should his marked price be greater than the original label price?
If apples are bought at the rate of 30 for Rs.100.  How many apples must be sold for Rs.100 so as to gain 20%?
One year payment to the servant is Rs. 200 plus one shirt.  The servant leaves after 9 months and receives Rs. 120 and a shirt. Then find the price of the shirt.
A merchant marks his goods in such a way that the profit on sale of 50 articles is equal to the selling price of 25 articles. What is his profit margin?
A merchant marks his goods up by 75% above his cost price. What is the maximum % Amount that he can offer so that he ends up selling at no profit or loss?
A man has some hens and cows. If the number of heads be 48 and the number of feet equals 140, then the number of hens will be:
A sum of Rs. 1360 has been divided among A, B and C such that A gets 2/3 of what B gets and B gets 1/4 of what C gets. B's share is:
If a-b= 3 and a2+b2=29, find the value of ab :
A man moves from A to B at the rate of 4 km/hr. Had he moved at the rate of 3.67 km/hr, he would have taken 3 hours more to reach the destination. What is the distance between A and B?
A man driving his bike at 24 kmph reaches his office 5 minutes late. Had he driven 25% faster on an average he would have reached 4 minutes earlier than the scheduled time. How far is his office?

A man and a woman 81 miles apart from each other, start traveling towards each other at the same time. If the man covers 5 miles per hour to the women's 4 miles per hour, how far will the woman have travelled when they meet?

The speed of a motorboat itself is 20 km/h and the rate of flow of the river is 4 km/h. Moving with the stream the boat went 120 km. What distance will the boat cover during the same time going against the stream?
I travel the first part of my journey at 40 kmph and the second part at 60 kmph and cover the total distance of 240 km to my destination in 5 hours. How long did the first part of my journey last?
By walking at 3/4th of his usual speed, a man reaches office 20 minutes later than usual. What is his usual time?
Ram covers a part of the journey at 20 kmph and the balance at 70 kmph taking total of 8 hours to cover the distance of 400 km. How many hours has been driving at 20 kmph?
A and B working together can finish a job in T days. If A works alone and completes the job, he will take T + 5 days. If B works alone and completes the same job, he will take T + 45 days. What is T?

A man can do a piece of work in 60 hours. If he takes his son with him and both work together then the work is finished in 40 hours. How long will the son take to do the same job, if he worked alone on the job?
A, B and C can do a work in 5 days, 10 days and 15 days respectively. They started together to do the work but after 2 days A and B left. C did the remaining work (in days)
X alone can do a piece of work in 15 days and Y alone can do it in 10 days. X and Y undertook to do it for Rs.720. With the help of Z they finished it in 5 days. How much is paid to Z?
Ram, who is half as efficient as Krish, will take 24 days to complete a work if he worked alone. If Ram and Krish worked together, how long will they take to complete the work?
If 10 letters are to be placed in 10 addressed envelopes, then what is the probability that at least one letter is placed in wrong addressed envelope?
Two letters are selected randomly from English alphabet simultaneously. What is the probability that one is a constant and the other a vowel?
A bag has 5 red balls and 3 green balls and another bag contains 4 green balls and 3 red balls. If one ball is drawn from each bag, then what is the probability that both are green balls?
The ratio of the number of boys and girls in a college is 7 : 8. If the percentage increase in the number of boys and girls be 20% and 10% respectively, what will be the new ratio?
p,q and r are three positive numbers and Q=(p+q+r)/2; If (Q-p):(Q-q):(Q-r) = 2:5:7, then find the ratio of p,q and r ?
A and B together have Rs. 1210. If 4/15 of A's amount is equal to 2/5 of B's amount, how much amount does B have?
Two numbers are respectively 20% and 50% more than a third number.The ratio of the two numbers is :
A sum of money is to be distributed among A, B, C, D in the proportion of 5 : 2 : 4 : 3. If C gets Rs. 1000 more than D, what is the total amount?
If Rs. 782 be divided into three parts, proportional to ยฝ:2/3:3/4, then the first part is:
A bag contains 50 paisa, 20 paisa and 10 paisa coins in the ratio 5:3:1.If the total amount in the bag is 640 Rs,find the difference in the amounts contributed by 50 paisa and 20 paisa coins.
